locations.name: Twinleaf Town
locations.description: A small town with the fresh scent of new leaves in the air. It feels like a place where adventures start. Your own home and your best friend's house are located here.

locations.name: Sandgem Town
locations.description: A sandy town that is located right next to a beach. It is redolent with the salty scent of the sea. Prof. Rowan's lab is the town's landmark. He conducts his studies on Pokémon here.

locations.name: Jubilife City
locations.description: The most modernized city in the Sinnoh region. It is bustling with people on the go.

locations.name: Oreburgh City
locations.description: A vibrant and energetic mining town that is blessed with a precious natural resource. There is a Gym where mine workers take breaks in between their exhausting work shifts. Huge deposits of coal still sleep underneath the ground. The entrance to the Oreburgh Mine is here.

locations.name: Floaroma Town
locations.description: A town of flower lovers, Floaroma Town is always perfumed with the sweet scent of flowers. A short, floral pathway opens up to a sprawling sea of flowers in bloom. In the center of town is the flower shop called Pick a Peck of Colors.

locations.name: Eterna City
locations.description: An old city that shows fading and almost-forgotten vestiges of ancient history. A Gym is indispensable in any town that has many people coming and going. This city is no exception. The Cycle Shop is located here. There is also a big building with a slightly sinister atmosphere. A statue of an ancient Pokémon is prominently and reverently displayed.

locations.name: Hearthome City
locations.description: This friendly city started as a place where people and Pokémon gathered, then grew into a center of commerce. If you care about the looks of your Pokémon, head for the Contest Hall. For toughness, go to the Gym. The entrance to Amity Square is here. The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon. There is a building here that is symbolic of the city's status as a place where different cultures meet. A nice fountain with benches, as well as the Pokémon Fan Club, are among the city's amenities.

locations.name: Solaceon Town
locations.description: The temperate climate makes this town a relaxed and casual place for people and Pokémon to live in. There is a Pokémon Day Care and a Pokémon Center here. Beyond a path hemmed by stands of trees, one can find the entrance to the Solaceon Ruins.

locations.name: Veilstone City
locations.description: This city was made by carving out steep, rocky mountains. Its isolation limits its contact with other cities. The city puts effort into providing entertainment. Naturally, one can find a Gym here. Conveniently located right next door to the Game Corner is the Prize Exchange. At the highest point in the city is Team Galactic's headquarters. There are warehouses for storing a variety of goods. There is also a major department store.

locations.name: Pastoria City
locations.description: This city was originally founded to protect the Great Marsh. It has grown naturally over the years. The Gym is a good example of the abundant water resources available to the city. There is a lookout that affords views of the Great Marsh. The gates to the Safari Zone are also here.

locations.name: Celestic Town
locations.description: A tiny town that preserves the history of Sinnoh and the old ways of life. In the center of the town is a small shrine that dates to ancient times.

locations.name: Canalave City
locations.description: A port city that is bisected by a canal. It has a distinctly exotic air of foreign culture. Head to the library if you want a workout for the mind. Head to the Gym if you just want to work out. Large ships can always be seen moored at the town's piers.

locations.name: Snowpoint City
locations.description: A winter wonderland of a city where stout trees and buildings are blanketed in thick snow. The Gym is at the heart of the city. To the north is the Snowpoint Temple.

locations.name: Sunyshore City
locations.description: A port city that was built around the bay portion of the cape. It is criss-crossed by elevated walkways. The Gym is located atop a rocky outcropping. Down on the beach is a festive bazaar. The Vista Lighthouse's bright beacon illuminates the Sinnoh region.

locations.name: Pokémon League
locations.description: Trainers seeking to be the best arrive here after a long and grueling journey. The Pokémon League reception counter is located here. Only those who have beaten all the Gyms may enter.

locations.name: Fight Area
locations.description: A tiny port city where Trainers who love battling more than eating gather. The gateway to the Battle Frontier is located here. Moored at the pier is the ferry to Snowpoint City.

locations.name: Survival Area
locations.description: A town where hot-blooded Trainers gather to work out and hone their battling skills.

locations.name: Resort Area
locations.description: A town that attracts Trainers who know there are other ways of enjoying Pokémon than battling.

locations.name: Route 201
locations.description: A small path through a lush, green, wooded area. The densely grown trees give off a thick aroma.

locations.name: Route 202
locations.description: A winding path that twists through grassy fields. Young Trainers like to test their battle skills here.

locations.name: Route 203
locations.description: Despite being so close to a big town, this path retains its relaxed, natural atmosphere. Once one gets through the tunnel, the city of Oreburgh is just a stone's throw away.

locations.name: Route 204
locations.description: A charming natural path that wanders past many ponds and groves of trees. The Ravaged Path was hewn through a rocky outcropping. It is a shortcut that leads straight to Floaroma Town.

locations.name: Route 205
locations.description: A quietly following stream and hilly terrain with one-way ledges make this a fun area for adventure. Near the entrance of the Eterna Forest is a cabin whose keepers offer rest to weary travelers that stop by. A wide, wooden walkway spans a large pond. Fishermen idle their time away dangling lines from the walkway.

locations.name: Route 206
locations.description: Smoothly paved in asphalt, the Cycling Road is heavenly for bicycle lovers. Below the Cycling Road, one can see the entrance to Wayward Cave.

locations.name: Route 207
locations.description: Located at the foot of Mt. Coronet, this road is carved into the rugged, rocky terrain.

locations.name: Route 208
locations.description: A lush field of grass spreads from Mt. Coronet's sheer rock face, creating a vista of contrasts. The Berry Master, an old man who loves nature, Pokémon, and Berries, makes his home here.

locations.name: Route 209
locations.description: The streams forded by this path wind past copses and grassy patches in a serene and soothing manner. The Lost Tower is where Pokémon are laid to rest when their lives come to an end.

locations.name: Route 210
locations.description: This narrow route is lined with deep, tall grass that tickles the noses of people straying off the path. The Cafe Cabin stands in a wood. The house special is freshly milked Moomoo Milk. A canyon covered by untamed fog. It is always shrouded by a dense fog.

locations.name: Route 211
locations.description: A mountain path that tunnels through Mt. Coronet, one of the tallest mountains in Sinnoh.

locations.name: Route 212
locations.description: A tall, sturdy wall surrounds an expansive estate that takes up nearly half of the road space. Beyond the wall, one can see the stately Pokémon Mansion and the owner's prized garden behind it. This path weaves among deep puddles made by the unending rainfall. It is wet and miserable for Trainers.

locations.name: Route 213
locations.description: Offshore boulders form a jetty that becalms waves reaching the beach. A resort hotel overlooks the water. In a small house on the beach lives a single man who refers to himself as Dr. Footstep.

locations.name: Route 214
locations.description: The road joining Veilstone City and a lake is described as either "wildly natural" or simply "a mess." There is a cave hewn into the sheer rock wall at the roadside. The hole was made by a Ruin Maniac.

locations.name: Route 215
locations.description: This area is always inundated by heavy rainfall. Only hardy Trainers that can take the rain gather here.

locations.name: Route 216
locations.description: This mountainous road leads from Mt. Coronet. Its constant snowfall and deep snowdrifts impede travelers.

locations.name: Route 217
locations.description: Snow blows down from Mt. Coronet and grows into a harsh, ceaseless blizzard. Be prepared for the worst.

locations.name: Route 218
locations.description: Despite its shortness, this road is revered by fishing enthusiasts as a great, yet little known, fishing spot.

locations.name: Route 219
locations.description: A beautiful white-sand beach only five seconds on foot from Sandgem Town. A pleasant breeze flows from the sea.

locations.name: Route 220
locations.description: The sea here is perfect for swimming, with gentle winds and tides. There are sandbars for resting too.

locations.name: Route 221
locations.description: A straight path hemmed by green grass and sparse stands of trees. At the end of the path stands the gateway to Pal Park.

locations.name: Route 222
locations.description: A sandy beach extends from the road. The beach is busy with avid Fishermen happily casting at the water's edge. A man who loves fishing lives near here. There is also a man who will compare sizes of caught fish.

locations.name: Route 223
locations.description: A marine route that requires travelers to navigate around jutting rocks and sandbars.

locations.name: Route 224
locations.description: With grass fields, rocky outcroppings, the sea, and sandbars, this area is like a miniature of the Sinnoh Region.

locations.name: Route 225
locations.description: The path makes its way up and down among rocky outcroppings. It is physically challenging.

locations.name: Route 226
locations.description: A path that winds precariously along sheer cliffs that go right to the edge of the sea's pounding waves. There is a small island in the bay. An odd man who speaks foreign languages lives there.

locations.name: Route 228
locations.description: This rough path is harshly raked by a horizontally blowing sandstorm driven by strong winds off the sea.

locations.name: Route 229
locations.description: A seaside path that makes its way through wildly growing trees and plants.

locations.name: Route 230
locations.description: A sea route that stretches from west to east. There is an island that is rich with plant life along the way.

locations.name: Lake Verity
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.

locations.name: Verity Lakefront
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.

locations.name: Verity Lakefront
locations.description: Once one gets through the tunnel, the city of Oreburgh is just a stone's throw away.

locations.name: Oreburgh Mine
locations.description: A coal mine located at the southern end of Oreburgh City.

locations.name: Oreburgh Mining Museum
locations.description: A museum that specializes in exhibits related to the town's coal mine.

locations.name: Global Terminal
locations.description: Also known as the Global Trade Station, or GTS for short. Here Trainers can access the Global Trade System, a worldwide network over which Trainers from all over the world can trade Pokémon.

locations.name: Ravaged Path
locations.description: A small cave that runs under Route 204.

locations.name: Floaroma Meadow
locations.description: Many Combee swarm to this flowery meadow. The trees here are often ripe with honey.

locations.name: Valley Windworks
locations.description: Numerous wind turbines stand in the vicinity of the Valley Windworks. Winds blowing through the canyon feed the wind turbines to generate clean electricity.

locations.name: Eterna Forest
locations.description: A forest enveloped in chilly air. Thick stands of trees turn the forest into a natural maze. Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.

locations.name: Old Chateau
locations.description: Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.

locations.name: Wayward Cave
locations.description: An underground cave near Cycling Road. It is easy to get lost due to all the twists and turns.

locations.name: Mt. Coronet
locations.description: A sacred mountain that is capped the year round with snow. A gigantic maze sprawls inside it. There is an ancient ruin named the Spear Pillar located here. A special magnetic fields emanates from this mountain.

locations.name: Spear Pillar
locations.description: An ancient ruin where the Legendary Pokémon Dialga, Palkia, and Giratina were created by Arceus and from which, legends say, Sinnoh itself came from.

locations.name: Amity Square
locations.description: The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon.

locations.name: Lost Tower
locations.description: A resting ground for deceased Pokémon. Trainers who pay their respects by making it to the top of the tower will receive gifts from the Tower's overseers.

locations.name: Hallowed Tower
locations.description: A crumbling tower located on Route 209. On it is an inscription that is unreadable.

locations.name: Solaceon Ruins
locations.description: A set of ruins outside of Solaceon Town, famous for the Unown that inhabit them.

locations.name: Maniac Tunnel
locations.description: A ruin maniac dug out this tunnel to gain access to hidden chambers of the Solaceon Ruins.

locations.name: Lake Valor
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. A high-class restaurant is located on a hill overlooking the lake.

locations.name: Valor Lakefront
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. A high-class restaurant is located on a hill overlooking the lake.

locations.name: Great Marsh
locations.description: Many Pokémon from Sinnoh can only be found in preservation. A railway provides transportation for Trainers to safely traverse the marshy terrain.

locations.name: Pokémon Mansion
locations.description: A big, old mansion owned by Mr. Backlot, the owner of Amity Square. The house is well-guarded outside. It is also the home of the famous Trophy Garden.

locations.name: Trophy Garden
locations.description: A beautiful garden located in the back of Pokémon Mansion. Many rare Pokémon can be found here.

locations.name: Fuego Ironworks
locations.description: The sprawling ironworks is located with the forest at its back. The ironworks refines iron ore mined from Mt. Coronet to make iron and to manufacture mechanical parts.

locations.name: Iron Island
locations.description: A small, ore-rich island that is off the coast of Eterna City. Inside the island are remnants of an iron ore mining operation from the past.

locations.name: Fullmoon Island
locations.description: A small, crescent-shaped pond that lies inside a closed-off forest.

locations.name: Newmoon Island
locations.description: A small, round pond that lies inside a closed-off forest.

locations.name: Lake Acuity
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.

locations.name: Acuity Lakefront
locations.description: One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.

locations.name: Victory Road
locations.description: Trainers seeking to be the best arrive here after a long and grueling journey. Victory Road is the last and toughest of the challenges leading up to the Pokémon League.

locations.name: Battle Frontier
locations.description: A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.

locations.name: Stark Mountain
locations.description: A rugged, seemingly indestructible rock mountain that is thickly blanketed by the volcanic ash it spews. Inside the mountain, fissures in spilled and hardened lava form enormous caverns.

locations.name: Snowpoint Temple
locations.description: A temple dedicated to the preservation of Regigigas, who slumbers deep inside the temple. Access to this temple is typically denied for those who wish to enter.

locations.name: Spring Path
locations.description: The fourth lake of Sinnoh that was kept secret. Beneath the lake's surface is a cave where dimensions are distorted.

locations.name: Sendoff Spring
locations.description: The fourth lake of Sinnoh that was kept secret. Beneath the lake's surface is a cave where dimensions are distorted.

locations.name: Turnback Cave
locations.description: A cave deep inside the Sendoff Springs. Ancient pillars with inscriptions aid explorers in navigating the mazelike tunnels.

locations.name: Seabreak Path
locations.description: A straight path bounded by the sea on both sides. It leads to the Flower Paradise.

locations.name: Flower Paradise
locations.description: A speck of an island far from any civilization. It is covered in an abundance of flowers.

locations.name: Hall of Origin
locations.description: Said to be located high above the Spear Pillar, this is where Arceus resides.

locations.name: Distortion World
locations.description: An alternate dimension controlled by the legendary Pokémon Giratina.
